newsitem.title: UK: Major stock movements overnight - Feb 13.
newsitem.headline: Major stock movements overnight - Feb 13.

text.p: LONDON - UK blue chip shares ended mixed after robust UK unemployment figures rekindled the debate over British interest rates, but gains on Wall Street later in he day helped to cap any losses. The FTSE 100 index of leading shares finished unchanged at 4,304.3.

FRANKFURT - Shares hit a record close in bourse trade -- boosted by the dollar's ongoing resilience against comments aimed at braking its rise -- and ended later screen-based trade broadly higher. The 30-share blue-chip DAX index set a lifetime closing high of 3,216.14, up 28.56. In post-bourse trade, the
IBIS DAX eased slightly to 3,211.01 points, as the rally's momentum faded.
PARIS - Shares ended higher, but just below the key 2,600 level, as continued dollar strength supported the market. The blue-chip CAC-40 index closed up 17.24 points at 2,599.33.

ZURICH - Shares showed no signs of slowing down, posting the tenth closing record in a row but slightly off the day's highest levels above 4,450 points on the blue-chip SMI. The blue-chip SMI ended up 35.7 points at 4,444.1. The all-share SPI was up

TOKYO - Stocks closed higher, as shares of major multinational companies continued to attract investors, supported by the yen's retreat against the dollar. But the market's upside was capped by strong selling demand. The key Nikkei 225 average rose 228.79 points to end at 18,409.96.

HONG KONG - Stocks recovered only a bit of lost ground to close up, boosted by a recovery in some heavy property counters but pulled down by selling in conglomerates and banks. The Hang Seng Index advanced just 8.40 points to 13,462.61, after zigzagged in a relatively narrow range for most of the day.
SYDNEY - Shares jumped convincingly, led by the banks after a stronger than expected half year profit by Commonwealth Bank. The All Ordinaries index rose 25.4 points to 2,473.5.

JOHANNESBURG - Gold shares ended slightly weaker depressed by a soft bullion price. Industrial shares eased in sympathy and were further pressured by some profit-taking. The overall index was down 8.3 points to 6,966.7 points, industrials lost 30.3 points to 8,262.8 points, and the gold index shed 8.3 points to 1,350.0 points.
